newsitem.title: USA: Raytheon E-Systems gets $228 mln contract.
newsitem.headline: Raytheon E-Systems gets $228 mln contract.

text.p: Raytheon E-Systems, a Raytheon Co unit, said Tuesday it has won a five-year contract worth more than $228 million to provide a voice command and control communications system to the U.S. government.
Raytheon said the contract follows a four-year project of $106 million that ended September 30. The new contract is funded from October 1 to September 30, 2001, Raytheon said.
The contract covers 36 sites supporting key command centers, including those for the President and the Secretary of Defense. It will provide secure and nonsecure digital switches, Raytheon said.
